item.title: Discrete randomness in Créteil
item.description:
Organisée par Aurelia Deshayes et moi, et financée par le LAMA et l’Université Paris Est Créteil, on vous invite à nous rejoindre pour cette journée sur quelques modèles discrets de probabilité.

Quand : mardi 12 décembre 2023 de 9h30 à 17h

Où : salle P1 033 à la Faculté des Sciences et Technologie de l’Université Paris Est Créteil | Plan d’accès et PDF du planning du campus

Inscription : ici

Orateurs :

  • Eleanor Archer (Modal’X, Université de Nanterre)
  • Anne Laure Basdevant (LPSM, Sorbonne Université )
  • Lucile Laulin (Modal’X, Université de Nanterre)
  • Nahuel Soprano Loto (LAAS, CNRS et CONICET)
  • Niccolo Torri (Modal’X, Université de Nanterre)
  • Nicolás Zalduendo (IECL, Université de Lorraine et INRIA Grand Est)

Le programme sera bientôt disponible !

Vous pouvez vous inscrire ici. L’inscription est gratuite (mais obligatoire si vous voulez participer au déjeuner).

Vous pouvez contacter Aurelia Deshayes et moi pour toute question en utilisant ce lien.

item.title: Curriculum Vitae
item.description:
PDF

Table of Contents
  • 1. Education
  • 2. Preprints
  • 3. Publications in Journals
  • 4. Publications in Conferences

1. Education

  • (2018-2021) PhD Mathematics, Université Paris-Dauphine, France
  • (2015-2017) MSc Mathematics, University of Havana, Cuba
  • (2011-2015) BSc Mathematics, University of Havana, Cuba

2. Preprints

  1. (2023) Arredondo, A., Corujo, J., Noûs, C., Boitard, S., Chikhi, L. and Mazet, O. Exact calculation of the expected SFS in structured populations biorXiv : 10.1101/2023.05.10.540112
  2. (2023) Corujo, J. and Limic, V. A dynamical approach to spanning and surplus edges of random graphs arXiv: 2305.04716
  3. (2023) Corujo, J. and Limic, V. The standard augmented multiplicative coalescent revisited arXiv: 2304.07545

3. Publications in Journals

  1. (2023) Corujo, J. On the spectrum and ergodicity of a neutral multi-allelic Moran model (pubished in ALEA) arXiv | HAL | DOI
  2. (2023) Corujo, J., Flores-Peñaloza, D., Huemer, C., Pérez-Lantero, P., Seara, C. Matching random colored points with rectangles (published in JOCO) URL
  3. (2022) Cloez, B. and Corujo, J. Uniform in time propagation of chaos for a Moran model (published in SPA) arXiv | HAL | DOI
  4. (2021) Corujo, J. and Valdés, J. E. Further results on stochastic orderings and aging classes in systems with age replacement (published in PEIS) HAL | DOI
  5. (2021) Corujo, J. Dynamics of a Fleming – Viot type particle system on the cycle graph (published in SPA) arXiv | HAL | DOI
  6. (2018) Rodríguez, W., Mazet, O., Grusea, S., Arredondo, A., Corujo, J., Boitard, S. and Chikhi, L. The IICR and the non-stationary structured coalescent: towards demographic inference with arbitrary changes in population structure (published in Heredity) HAL | DOI
  7. (2018) Corujo, J., Valdés, J. E. and Laria, J. C. Stochastic comparisons of two-unit repairable systems (published in CS-TM) arXiv | DOI

4. Publications in Conferences

  1. (2020) Corujo, J., Flores-Peñaloza, D., Huemer, C., Pérez-Lantero, P., Seara, C. Matching random colored points with rectangles WALCOM 2020 LNCS volume 12049 | DOI

5. PhD Manuscript

  • (2021) Corujo, J. Multi-allelic Moran models and quasi-stationary distributions. Université Paris-Dauphine. PDF

6. Conferences and Talks

  1. (October 2023) Talk: Random graphs and the augmented multiplicative coalescent Groupe de travail probabilités, Créteil, France.
  2. (June 2023) Invited speaker for the 21st INFORMS APS Conference. Talk: Convergence of the empirical measure induced by a Moran type particle system (Slides), Nancy, France. Poster: The standard augmented multiplicative coalescent revisited (Best Poster Award)
  3. (June 2023) Talk: The standard augmented multiplicative coalescent revisited Journées de Probabilité 2023, Angers, France. Slides
  4. (June 2023) Chalk Talk, Instituto Gulbenkian de Ciência, Lisbon, Portugal. Slides
  5. (April 2023) Talk: Large population limits for a mutation-selection Moran model. Séminaire Maths-Bio, Institut de Mathématiques de Toulouse, France.
  6. (October 2022) Talk: A dynamical approach to spanning and surplus edges of random graphs, Séminaire de Probabilités y Statistique, IECL Nancy, France. Slides
  7. (October 2022) Talk: Some recent advances in the multiplicative coalescent and near-critical random graphs, ITI IRMIA++ Day, Strasbourg, France
  8. (October 2022) Poster: IICR of structured populations with size change: strong and weak migration. Journées Math Bio Santé 2022, Besançon, France | Julia Notebooks for the plots
  9. (May 2022) Summer School Mathematics of Large Networks, Budapest, Hungary
  10. (Apr. 2022) Talk: Spectrum and ergodicity of a neutral multi-allelic Moran model, Recent progress in probabilistic modelling of population genetics, Royal Statistical Society, UK
  11. (Apr. 2022) Talk: A neutral multi-allelic Moran model: spectral elements and cutoff, Séminaire (de calcul) stochastique de Strasbourg, Strasbourg
  12. (Mar. 2022) Talk: Speed of convergence to the mean-field limit for a mutation-selection particle system. Workshop ANR QuAMProcs, Inria Paris, France
  13. (Dec. 2021) Talk: Propagation of chaos for a multi-allelic Moran model. GDR MAMOVI 2021, Ecole Polytechnique, France.
  14. (Jul. 2021) 5th Workshop on Probability and Evolution. CIRM, Marseille, France
  15. (Jun. 2021) Talk: Spectrum and ergodicity of a neutral Moran model. Seminario de Probabilità, Analisi Stocastica e Statistica, Università di Pisa, Italy
  16. (Feb. 2021) Talk: Spectrum of the neutral Moran model and its long time behaviour. Journée de doctorants en Probabilités, Institut de Mathématiques de Toulouse, France
  17. (Dec. 2020) Talk: On the spectrum of a neutral multi-allelic Moran model. Séminaire de Probabilités, Institut de Mathématiques de Toulouse, France
  18. (Nov. 2020) Talk: Spectral properties of a neutral multi-allelic Moran model. Séminaire de Probabilité et Statistique, Montpellier, France.
  19. (Mar. 2020) Talk: Convergence of a Fleming–Viot type particle system on the cycle graph. 14th International Conference on Operations Research, Havana, Cuba
  20. (Feb. 2020) Research school EDP et probabilité pour la biologie. CIRM, Marseille, France
  21. (Dec. 2019) Poster: Quantitative results on a multi-allelic Moran type model with mutation. Workshop on Models and Inference in Population Genetics, Warwick University, UK
  22. (Sep. 2019) Talk: Quantitative results for a Moran type particle process in the cycle graph. GDR MAMOVI 2019, Université de Tours, France
  23. (Jul. 2017) Talk: Stochastic Comparisons of Two-Units Markovian Reparable Systems. 10th International Conference on Mathematical Methods in Reliability, Grenoble, France

item.title: Numerical simulations for chalk talk
item.description:
Chalk talk

Josué Corujo

Instituto Gulbenkian de Ciência, 6th June 2023

Digression: theorem-proof and scientific modelling mathematics
To ask ‘‘what is known’’ in this subject leads inexorably to philosophical issues concerning pure and applied mathematics… I call this scientific modelling (SM) mathematics, as opposed to theorem-proof (TP) mathematics, which is the style of all ‘‘pure’’ and much of what is called ‘‘applied’’ mathematics. In SM mathematics, models may be incompletely or inconsistently specified; the focus is on obtaining conclusions about the model, allowing appeals to physical realism, unquantified approximations, and arguments by analogy. In TP mathematics, one is supposed to have explicit assumptions and conclusions, as well as a rigorous argument linking them.
- David Aldous (Bernoulli 5(1), 1999, 3-48)

Erdös-Rényi random graph

The limit process

$$ B_t(s) = W_t(s) - \inf_{0 \leq u \leq s} W_t(u),$$ where $ W_t(s) = W(s) - \frac{1}{2}s^2 + t s $.

  • $X_i(t)$: $i$th largest excursion of $B_t(\cdot)$ above zero,

  • $\big( \pmb{X}(t), t \ge 0 \big) $ is a realization of an eternal multiplicative coalescent.

  • $\Lambda$: homogeneous Poisson point process on $\mathbb{R}_+^2$,
  • $X_i(t)$: $i$th largest excursion above zero,
  • $Y_i(t)$: nb. of marks below the curve during the $i$th largest excursion.

$\big( (\pmb{X}(t), \pmb{Y}(t)), t \ge 0 \big) $ is a realization of an eternal augmented multiplicative coalescent.

Thanks for your attention!

Numerical simulations for the (augmented) multiplicative coalescent
item.description:
Simulations for the (augmented) multiplicative coalescent

$$ B_t(s) = W_t(s) - \inf_{0 \leq u \leq s} W_t(u),$$ where $ W_t(s) = W(s) - \frac{1}{2}s^2 + t s $.

  • $X_i(t)$: $i$th largest excursion of $B_t(\cdot)$ above zero,

  • $\big( \pmb{X}(t), t \ge 0 \big) $ is a realization of an eternal multiplicative coalescent.

  • $\Lambda$: homogeneous Poisson point process on $\mathbb{R}_+^2$,
  • $X_i(t)$: $i$th largest excursion above zero,
  • $Y_i(t)$: nb. of marks below the curve during the $i$th largest excursion.

$\big( (\pmb{X}(t), \pmb{Y}(t)), t \ge 0 \big) $ is a realization of an eternal augmented multiplicative coalescent.

Thanks for your attention!

item.title: Stochastic comparisons of two-unit repairable systems
The IICR and the non-stationary structured coalescent: towards demographic inference with arbitrary changes in population structure
